hackathon-description-text: Unituhack is the first student & staff hackathon, bringing them together to form a team for one day to co-create technological innovations and solutions to specific challenges found in universities.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Academic Enhancement and Course Leader, MA Ed at Buckinghamshire New University
Student Activities and Representation Coordinator and at the Quality Assurance Agency

hackathon-eligibility: To submit your project, you have to attend Unituhack Warwick and be a student/developer/designer/university staff member.
hackathon-requirements: When you submit your project, make sure you submit a description of your project before the hacking time is finished.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=WMG, IIPSI, University Road, University of Warwick, Coventry, CV4 7AL

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How well does the solution solve the problem? Is it better than other solutions/services currently being used?
How well was the product built/designed? Is it intuitive?
How many people does your solution have an impact on? Does it have an impact on both students and staff? Does your product adapt to types of users?
Can your product be used in different departments and universities? How efficiently and effectively can it scale across to different departments and universities?

Overall effectiveness of the presentation. Did the presenter(s) engage the audience and hold their attention?
Were visual aids clear and valuable?
Was the pitch exciting and compelling?
How efficiently did the team allot their time?

hackathon-location-address: WMG, IIPSI, University Road, University of Warwick, Coventry, CV4 7AL
hackathon-description-header: Create solutions to your educational challenges
